case_vignette:
A 33-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a fever and fatigue. He states that he has not felt well since he returned from a hiking trip in Alabama. He is generally healthy and has no other medical conditions. His temperature is 101°F (38.3°C), blood pressure is 127/85 mmHg, pulse is 108/min, respirations are 14/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Physical exam including a full dermatologic inspection is unremarkable. Laboratory studies are ordered as seen below.

Hemoglobin: 13 g/dL
Hematocrit: 39%
Leukocyte count: 2,200/mm^3 with normal differential
Platelet count: 77,000/mm^3

Serum:
Na+: 139 mEq/L
Cl-: 100 mEq/L
K+: 4.3 mEq/L
HCO3-: 24 mEq/L
BUN: 19 mg/dL
Glucose: 98 mg/dL
Creatinine: 1.3 mg/dL
Ca2+: 10.2 mg/dL
AST: 92 U/L
ALT: 100 U/L
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling feverish and really tired lately.
Have you had any cough or difficulty breathing?
No, I haven't had a cough or difficulty breathing.
Have you had any recent travel history or contact with someone who has been sick?
Yes, I just got back from a hiking trip in Alabama.
Have you been taking any medications for any pre-existing conditions?
No, I don't have any other medical conditions and I'm not on any medications.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
No, my sleep patterns have not changed recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your mood or behavior?
No, there haven't been any changes in my mood or behavior.
Have you had any recent changes in your skin or mucous membranes?
No, there haven't been any noticeable changes in my skin or mucous membranes.
Have you had any recent changes in your vision or hearing?
No changes in my vision or hearing.
Have you had any recent changes in your urine or stool?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my urine or stool.
Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle?
As a man, I do not have a menstrual cycle.
Have you had any recent changes in your sexual activity?
No recent changes in sexual activity.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
No, my sleep patterns have not changed recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your mood or behavior?

trial_0.summarized_conversation: The individual has been feeling feverish and significantly tired lately. They have not experienced a cough or difficulty breathing. The symptoms began after a recent hiking trip in Alabama. The person does not have any other medical conditions and is not taking any medications. There have been no changes in appetite, weight, sleep patterns, mood, behavior, skin, mucous membranes, vision, hearing, urine, stool, or sexual activity.
trial_0.vignette_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Babesiosis.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is Lyme disease.
trial_0.summarized_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Ehrlichiosis.
trial_0.summarized_frq: The most likely diagnosis is Lyme disease.
